service:
Amazon WorkMail is a secure, managed business email and calendaring service with support for existing desktop and mobile email clients. You can access your email, contacts, and calendars using Microsoft Outlook, your browser, or other native iOS and Android email applications. You can integrate WorkMail with your existing corporate directory and control both the keys that encrypt your data and the location in which your data is stored.

The WorkMail API is designed for the following scenarios:

  • Listing and describing organizations

  • Managing users

  • Managing groups

  • Managing resources

All WorkMail API operations are Amazon-authenticated and certificate-signed. They not only require the use of the AWS SDK, but also allow for the exclusive use of AWS Identity and Access Management users and roles to help facilitate access, trust, and permission policies. By creating a role and allowing an IAM user to access the WorkMail site, the IAM user gains full administrative visibility into the entire WorkMail organization (or as set in the IAM policy). This includes, but is not limited to, the ability to create, update, and delete users, groups, and resources. This allows developers to perform the scenarios listed above, as well as give users the ability to grant access on a selective basis using the IAM model.

operations.AssociateDelegateToResource: Adds a member (user or group) to the resource's set of delegates.
operations.AssociateMemberToGroup: Adds a member (user or group) to the group's set.
operations.CreateAlias: Adds an alias to the set of a given member (user or group) of Amazon WorkMail.
operations.CreateGroup: Creates a group that can be used in Amazon WorkMail by calling the RegisterToWorkMail operation.
operations.CreateUser: Creates a user who can be used in Amazon WorkMail by calling the RegisterToWorkMail operation.
operations.DeleteAlias: Remove one or more specified aliases from a set of aliases for a given user.
operations.DeleteMailboxPermissions: Deletes permissions granted to a member (user or group).
operations.DeleteUser:
Deletes a user from Amazon WorkMail and all subsequent systems. Before you can delete a user, the user state must be DISABLED. Use the DescribeUser action to confirm the user state.

Deleting a user is permanent and cannot be undone. WorkMail archives user mailboxes for 30 days before they are permanently removed.
operations.DeregisterFromWorkMail: Mark a user, group, or resource as no longer used in Amazon WorkMail. This action disassociates the mailbox and schedules it for clean-up. WorkMail keeps mailboxes for 30 days before they are permanently removed. The functionality in the console is Disable.
operations.DescribeGroup: Returns the data available for the group.
operations.DescribeOrganization: Provides more information regarding a given organization based on its identifier.
operations.DescribeResource: Returns the data available for the resource.
operations.DisassociateDelegateFromResource: Removes a member from the resource's set of delegates.
operations.GetMailboxDetails: Requests a user's mailbox details for a specified organization and user.
operations.ListAliases: Creates a paginated call to list the aliases associated with a given entity.
operations.ListGroupMembers: Returns an overview of the members of a group. Users and groups can be members of a group.
operations.ListMailboxPermissions: Lists the mailbox permissions associated with a user, group, or resource mailbox.
operations.ListOrganizations: Returns summaries of the customer's non-deleted organizations.
operations.ListResourceDelegates: Lists the delegates associated with a resource. Users and groups can be resource delegates and answer requests on behalf of the resource.
operations.PutMailboxPermissions: Sets permissions for a user, group, or resource. This replaces any pre-existing permissions.
operations.RegisterToWorkMail:
Registers an existing and disabled user, group, or resource for Amazon WorkMail use by associating a mailbox and calendaring capabilities. It performs no change if the user, group, or resource is enabled and fails if the user, group, or resource is deleted. This operation results in the accumulation of costs. For more information, see Pricing. The equivalent console functionality for this operation is Enable.

Users can either be created by calling the CreateUser API operation or they can be synchronized from your directory. For more information, see DeregisterFromWorkMail.
operations.ResetPassword: Allows the administrator to reset the password for a user.
operations.UpdateMailboxQuota: Updates a user's current mailbox quota for a specified organization and user.
operations.UpdatePrimaryEmailAddress: Updates the primary email for a user, group, or resource. The current email is moved into the list of aliases (or swapped between an existing alias and the current primary email), and the email provided in the input is promoted as the primary.
operations.UpdateResource: Updates data for the resource. To have the latest information, it must be preceded by a DescribeResource call. The dataset in the request should be the one expected when performing another DescribeResource call.

BookingOptions.base: At least one delegate must be associated to the resource to disable automatic replies from the resource.

refs.DescribeResourceResponse$BookingOptions: The booking options for the described resource.
refs.UpdateResourceRequest$BookingOptions: The resource's booking options to be updated.

refs.BookingOptions$AutoAcceptRequests: The resource's ability to automatically reply to requests. If disabled, delegates must be associated to the resource.
refs.BookingOptions$AutoDeclineRecurringReque: The resource's ability to automatically decline any recurring requests.
refs.BookingOptions$AutoDeclineConflictingReq: The resource's ability to automatically decline any conflicting requests.

Delegate.base: The name of the attribute, which is one of the values defined in the UserAttribute enumeration.

DirectoryServiceAuthenticationFailedExce.base: The directory service doesn't recognize the credentials supplied by WorkMail.

DirectoryUnavailableException.base: The directory on which you are trying to perform operations isn't available.

refs.CreateAliasRequest$Alias: The alias to add to the member set.
refs.DeleteAliasRequest$Alias: The aliases to be removed from the user's set of aliases. Duplicate entries in the list are collapsed into single entries (the list is transformed into a set).
refs.RegisterToWorkMailRequest$Email: The email for the user, group, or resource to be updated.
refs.UpdatePrimaryEmailAddressRequest$Email: The value of the email to be updated as primary.

EmailAddressInUseException.base: The email address that you're trying to assign is already created for a different user, group, or resource.

EntityAlreadyRegisteredException.base: The user, group, or resource that you're trying to register is already registered.

EntityNotFoundException.base: The identifier supplied for the user, group, or resource does not exist in your organization.

refs.DescribeGroupResponse$State: The state of the user: enabled (registered to Amazon WorkMail) or disabled (deregistered or never registered to WorkMail).
refs.DescribeResourceResponse$State: The state of the resource: enabled (registered to Amazon WorkMail) or disabled (deregistered or never registered to WorkMail).
refs.DescribeUserResponse$State: The state of a user: enabled (registered to Amazon WorkMail) or disabled (deregistered or never registered to WorkMail).
refs.Group$State: The state of the group, which can be ENABLED, DISABLED, or DELETED.
refs.Member$State: The state of the member, which can be ENABLED, DISABLED, or DELETED.
refs.Resource$State: The state of the resource, which can be ENABLED, DISABLED, or DELETED.
refs.User$State: The state of the user, which can be ENABLED, DISABLED, or DELETED.

EntityStateException.base: You are performing an operation on a user, group, or resource that isn't in the expected state, such as trying to delete an active user.

Group.base: The representation of an Amazon WorkMail group.

refs.ListGroupsResponse$Groups: The overview of groups for an organization.

InvalidConfigurationException.base: The configuration for a resource isn't valid. A resource must either be able to auto-respond to requests or have at least one delegate associated that can do so on its behalf.

InvalidParameterException.base: One or more of the input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

InvalidPasswordException.base: The supplied password doesn't match the minimum security constraints, such as length or use of special characters.

MailDomainNotFoundException.base: For an email or alias to be created in Amazon WorkMail, the included domain must be defined in the organization.

MailDomainStateException.base: After a domain has been added to the organization, it must be verified. The domain is not yet verified.

refs.GetMailboxDetailsResponse$MailboxQuota: The maximum allowed mailbox size, in MB, for the specified user.
refs.UpdateMailboxQuotaRequest$MailboxQuota: The updated mailbox quota, in MB, for the specified user.

refs.GetMailboxDetailsResponse$MailboxSize: The current mailbox size, in MB, for the specified user.

refs.ListAliasesRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListGroupMembersRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListGroupsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListMailboxPermissionsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListOrganizationsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListResourceDelegatesRequest$MaxResults: The number of maximum results in a page.
refs.ListResourcesRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.
refs.ListUsersRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.

Member.base: The representation of a user or group.

refs.Delegate$Type: The type of the delegate: user or group.
refs.Member$Type: A member can be a user or group.
refs.Permission$GranteeType: The type of user, group, or resource referred to in GranteeId.

NameAvailabilityException.base: The user, group, or resource name isn't unique in Amazon WorkMail.

refs.ListAliasesRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListAliasesResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The value is "null" when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListGroupMembersRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListGroupMembersResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListGroupsRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListGroupsResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The value is "null" when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListMailboxPermissionsRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListMailboxPermissionsResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The value is "null" when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListOrganizationsRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListOrganizationsResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The value is "null" when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListResourceDelegatesRequest$NextToken: The token used to paginate through the delegates associated with a resource.
refs.ListResourceDelegatesResponse$NextToken: The token used to paginate through the delegates associated with a resource. While results are still available, it has an associated value. When the last page is reached, the token is empty.
refs.ListResourcesRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListResourcesResponse$NextToken: The token used to paginate through all the organization's resources. While results are still available, it has an associated value. When the last page is reached, the token is empty.
refs.ListUsersRequest$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. The first call does not contain any tokens.
refs.ListUsersResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is `null` when there are no more results to return.

refs.AssociateDelegateToResourceRequest$Organ: The organization under which the resource exists.
refs.AssociateMemberToGroupRequest$Organizati: The organization under which the group exists.
refs.CreateAliasRequest$OrganizationId: The organization under which the member (user or group) exists.
refs.CreateGroupRequest$OrganizationId: The organization under which the group is to be created.
refs.CreateResourceRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier associated with the organization for which the resource is created.
refs.CreateUserRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier of the organization for which the user is created.
refs.DeleteAliasRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the user exists.
refs.DeleteMailboxPermissionsRequest$Organiza: The identifier of the organization under which the member (user or group) exists.
refs.DeleteResourceRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier associated with the organization from which the resource is deleted.
refs.DeleteUserRequest$OrganizationId: The organization that contains the user to be deleted.
refs.DeregisterFromWorkMailRequest$Organizati: The identifier for the organization under which the Amazon WorkMail entity exists.
refs.DescribeGroupRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the group exists.
refs.DescribeOrganizationRequest$Organization: The identifier for the organization to be described.
refs.DescribeResourceRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier associated with the organization for which the resource is described.
refs.DescribeUserRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the user exists.
refs.DisassociateDelegateFromResourceRequest$: The identifier for the organization under which the resource exists.
refs.DisassociateMemberFromGroupRequest$Organ: The identifier for the organization under which the group exists.
refs.GetMailboxDetailsRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization that contains the user whose mailbox details are being requested.
refs.ListAliasesRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the entity exists.
refs.ListGroupMembersRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the group exists.
refs.ListGroupsRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the groups exist.
refs.ListMailboxPermissionsRequest$Organizati: The identifier of the organization under which the user, group, or resource exists.
refs.ListResourceDelegatesRequest$Organizatio: The identifier for the organization that contains the resource for which delegates are listed.
refs.ListResourcesRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the resources exist.
refs.ListUsersRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the users exist.
refs.PutMailboxPermissionsRequest$Organizatio: The identifier of the organization under which the user, group, or resource exists.
refs.RegisterToWorkMailRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization under which the user, group, or resource exists.
refs.ResetPasswordRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier of the organization that contains the user for which the password is reset.
refs.UpdateMailboxQuotaRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier for the organization that contains the user for whom to update the mailbox quota.
refs.UpdatePrimaryEmailAddressRequest$Organiz: The organization that contains the user, group, or resource to update.
refs.UpdateResourceRequest$OrganizationId: The identifier associated with the organization for which the resource is updated.

OrganizationNotFoundException.base: An operation received a valid organization identifier that either doesn't belong or exist in the system.

OrganizationStateException.base: The organization must have a valid state (Active or Synchronizing) to perform certain operations on the organization or its members.

refs.ListOrganizationsResponse$OrganizationSu: The overview of owned organizations presented as a list of organization summaries.

Permission.base: Permission granted to a user, group, or resource to access a certain aspect of another user, group, or resource mailbox.

refs.Permission$PermissionValues: The permissions granted to the grantee. SEND_AS allows the grantee to send email as the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned on these emails). SEND_ON_BEHALF allows the grantee to send email on behalf of the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned as the physical sender of these emails). FULL_ACCESS allows the grantee full access to the mailbox, irrespective of other folder-level permissions set on the mailbox.
refs.PutMailboxPermissionsRequest$PermissionV: The permissions granted to the grantee. SEND_AS allows the grantee to send email as the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned on these emails). SEND_ON_BEHALF allows the grantee to send email on behalf of the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned as the physical sender of these emails). FULL_ACCESS allows the grantee full access to the mailbox, irrespective of other folder-level permissions set on the mailbox.

refs.ListMailboxPermissionsResponse$Permissio: One page of the user, group, or resource mailbox permissions.

ReservedNameException.base: This user, group, or resource name is not allowed in Amazon WorkMail.

refs.AssociateDelegateToResourceRequest$Resou: The resource for which members (users or groups) are associated.
refs.DeleteResourceRequest$ResourceId: The identifier of the resource to be deleted.
refs.DescribeResourceRequest$ResourceId: The identifier of the resource to be described.
refs.DisassociateDelegateFromResourceRequest$: The identifier of the resource from which delegates' set members are removed.
refs.UpdateResourceRequest$ResourceId: The identifier of the resource to be updated.

refs.UpdateResourceRequest$Name: The name of the resource to be updated.

refs.CreateResourceRequest$Type: The type of the new resource. The available types are equipment and room.
refs.Resource$Type: The type of the resource: equipment or room.

refs.ListResourcesResponse$Resources: One page of the organization's resource representation.

refs.CreateUserRequest$DisplayName: The display name for the new user.
refs.Delegate$Id: The identifier for the user or group associated as the resource's delegate.
refs.DescribeOrganizationResponse$DirectoryId: The identifier for the directory associated with an Amazon WorkMail organization.
refs.DescribeOrganizationResponse$DirectoryTy: The type of directory associated with the WorkMail organization.
refs.DescribeOrganizationResponse$DefaultMail: The default mail domain associated with the organization.
refs.DescribeOrganizationResponse$ErrorMessag: (Optional) The error message indicating if unexpected behavior was encountered with regards to the organization.
refs.OrganizationSummary$ErrorMessage: The error message associated with the organization. It is only present if unexpected behavior has occurred with regards to the organization. It provides insight or solutions regarding unexpected behavior.

refs.DescribeGroupResponse$EnabledDate: The date and time when a user was registered to WorkMail, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeGroupResponse$DisabledDate: The date and time when a user was deregistered from WorkMail, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeOrganizationResponse$CompletedDa: The date at which the organization became usable in the WorkMail context, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeResourceResponse$EnabledDate: The date and time when a resource was enabled for WorkMail, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeResourceResponse$DisabledDate: The date and time when a resource was disabled from WorkMail, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeUserResponse$EnabledDate: The date and time at which the user was enabled for Amazon WorkMail usage, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.DescribeUserResponse$DisabledDate: The date and time at which the user was disabled for Amazon WorkMail usage, in UNIX epoch time format.
refs.Group$EnabledDate: The date indicating when the group was enabled for Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.Group$DisabledDate: The date indicating when the group was disabled from Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.Member$EnabledDate: The date indicating when the member was enabled for Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.Member$DisabledDate: The date indicating when the member was disabled from Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.Resource$EnabledDate: The date indicating when the resource was enabled for Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.Resource$DisabledDate: The date indicating when the resource was disabled from Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.User$EnabledDate: The date indicating when the user was enabled for Amazon WorkMail use.
refs.User$DisabledDate: The date indicating when the user was disabled from Amazon WorkMail use.

UnsupportedOperationException.base: You can't perform a write operation against a read-only directory.

User.base: The representation of an Amazon WorkMail user.

refs.CreateUserRequest$Name: The name for the new user. Simple AD or AD Connector user names have a maximum length of 20. All others have a maximum length of 64.

refs.DescribeUserResponse$UserRole: In certain cases, other entities are modeled as users. If interoperability is enabled, resources are imported into Amazon WorkMail as users. Because different WorkMail organizations rely on different directory types, administrators can distinguish between an unregistered user (account is disabled and has a user role) and the directory administrators. The values are USER, RESOURCE, and SYSTEM_USER.

refs.ListUsersResponse$Users: The overview of users for an organization.

refs.AssociateDelegateToResourceRequest$Entit: The member (user or group) to associate to the resource.
refs.AssociateMemberToGroupRequest$GroupId: The group to which the member (user or group) is associated.
refs.AssociateMemberToGroupRequest$MemberId: The member (user or group) to associate to the group.
refs.CreateAliasRequest$EntityId: The member (user or group) to which this alias is added.
refs.DeleteAliasRequest$EntityId: The identifier for the member (user or group) from which to have the aliases removed.
refs.DeleteGroupRequest$GroupId: The identifier of the group to be deleted.
refs.DeleteMailboxPermissionsRequest$EntityId: The identifier of the member (user or group)that owns the mailbox.
refs.DeleteMailboxPermissionsRequest$GranteeI: The identifier of the member (user or group) for which to delete granted permissions.
refs.DeleteUserRequest$UserId: The identifier of the user to be deleted.
refs.DeregisterFromWorkMailRequest$EntityId: The identifier for the member (user or group) to be updated.
refs.DescribeGroupRequest$GroupId: The identifier for the group to be described.
refs.DescribeUserRequest$UserId: The identifier for the user to be described.
refs.DisassociateDelegateFromResourceRequest$: The identifier for the member (user, group) to be removed from the resource's delegates.
refs.DisassociateMemberFromGroupRequest$Group: The identifier for the group from which members are removed.
refs.DisassociateMemberFromGroupRequest$Membe: The identifier for the member to be removed to the group.
refs.GetMailboxDetailsRequest$UserId: The identifier for the user whose mailbox details are being requested.
refs.ListAliasesRequest$EntityId: The identifier for the entity for which to list the aliases.
refs.ListGroupMembersRequest$GroupId: The identifier for the group to which the members (users or groups) are associated.
refs.ListMailboxPermissionsRequest$EntityId: The identifier of the user, group, or resource for which to list mailbox permissions.
refs.ListResourceDelegatesRequest$ResourceId: The identifier for the resource whose delegates are listed.
refs.Permission$GranteeId: The identifier of the user, group, or resource to which the permissions are granted.
refs.PutMailboxPermissionsRequest$EntityId: The identifier of the user, group, or resource for which to update mailbox permissions.
refs.PutMailboxPermissionsRequest$GranteeId: The identifier of the user, group, or resource to which to grant the permissions.
refs.RegisterToWorkMailRequest$EntityId: The identifier for the user, group, or resource to be updated.
refs.ResetPasswordRequest$UserId: The identifier of the user for whom the password is reset.
refs.UpdateMailboxQuotaRequest$UserId: The identifer for the user for whom to update the mailbox quota.
refs.UpdatePrimaryEmailAddressRequest$EntityI: The user, group, or resource to update.
